repnme.cdata!:
St. Lucia - OECS Skills for Inclusive
            Growth Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the OECS Skills for
            Inclusive Growth Project for St Lucia were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was moderate, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: targeting the most vulnerable
            sectors of the population, particularly poor at-risk youth
            who tend to have structurally less access to labor markets
            than their peers from other socio-economic groups, is a
            clear priority from an equity perspective. The argument for
            also including more educated, unemployed youth is supported
            on the grounds of both equity and efficiency, particularly
            in times of high unemployment. Both employers and trainees
            appear to value them greatly. Under the project, soft skills
            were emphasized throughout the training, including the
            technical training and the internship. The success of the
            training programs is highly susceptible to operational
            factors such as amount and timeliness of stipends. The
            remarkable decrease in drop-out rates as a result of
            fine-tuning operational details attest to their importance.

repnme.cdata!:
St. Lucia - OECS Skills for Inclusive
            Growth Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the OECS Skills for
            Inclusive Growth Project is to assist the Government of St.
            Lucia to increase the employability of youth through
            private-sector driven training. It was first restructured on
            December 5, 2011, and it is expected to close on September
            15, 2013. It has three components: 1) skills training for
            unemployed youth; 2) improving the policy framework for
            delivering of training; and 3) project management and
            institutional strengthening. The major change and rationale
            for this level two project restructuring is to revise the
            Project Development Objective (PDO) indicator in order to
            better measure the project's impact on the
            employability of youth over the long term.

docna.cdata!:
St. Lucia - OECS Skills for Inclusive Growth
            Project : restructuring

repnme.cdata!:
St. Lucia - OECS Skills for Inclusive
            Growth Project (Adaptable Program Lending) : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the OECS (Organization
            of Eastern Caribbean States) Skills for Inclusive Growth
            Project (Adaptable Program Lending) is to assist the
            Government of St. Lucia to increase the employability of
            youth through private-sector driven training. The
            restructuring includes: (a) changes to the scope of
            activities; (b) revisions to project financing; (c) an
            update of the results framework; and (d) an extension of the
            closing date. In summary, the changes entail the following:
            i) a reduction in the number of trainees to be better
            aligned to market absorption capacity; ii) an elimination of
            the monetary contribution of employers to the training
            scheme in order to offset the economic downturn and
            encourage their participation; and iii) a shift in resources
            from training to building and sustaining the policy
            framework for competency-based training and quality assurance.

display_title.display_title:
St. Lucia - OECS Skills for
            Inclusive Growth Project (Adaptable Program Lending) :
            restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
